tags.name: Annual Report
tags.description: A yearly report by a company detailing its financial performance and activities for shareholders.

tags.name: Analyst Ratings
tags.description: An evaluation by a financial analyst on a stock's future performance, often as 'buy', 'hold', or 'sell'.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: The development of computer systems that can perform tasks normally requiring human intelligence.

tags.name: Asset Management
tags.description: The professional management of investments, such as stocks and bonds, on behalf of clients.

tags.name: Asset Purchase
tags.description: The acquisition of a company's assets, rather than its shares.

tags.name: Award
tags.description: A formal recognition or prize given to a company for achievement or excellence.

tags.name: Bonds
tags.description: A fixed-income security representing a loan made by an investor to a borrower, such as a company or government.

tags.name: Bonus
tags.description: An extra payment made to an employee, often as a reward for good performance.

tags.name: Business Expansion
tags.description: A company's growth phase involving an increase in size or scope, such as entering new markets.

tags.name: Capital & Funding
tags.description: The financial resources, raised through debt or equity, used by a company to fund its operations.

tags.name: Central Bank
tags.description: A national institution that manages a country's currency, money supply, and interest rates, like Bank Indonesia.

tags.name: Commodities
tags.description: Raw materials or basic agricultural products that can be bought and sold, such as oil or coffee.

tags.name: Credit
tags.description: An agreement where a borrower receives something of value now and agrees to repay the lender later, usually with interest.

tags.name: Cryptocurrency
tags.description: A digital currency secured by cryptography, making it difficult to counterfeit.

tags.name: Currency & FX
tags.description: The system of money in a country (Currency) and the exchange of one currency for another (Foreign Exchange or FX).

tags.name: Cyber Security
tags.description: The practice of protecting networks, systems, and data from digital attacks or unauthorized access.

tags.name: Debt Issuance
tags.description: The process of a company or government raising capital by selling debt instruments like bonds.

tags.name: Delisting
tags.description: The official removal of a company's stock from a stock exchange.

tags.name: Digital Payments
tags.description: Financial transactions conducted online or through digital devices without the physical exchange of money.

tags.name: Digital Transformation
tags.description: The integration of digital technology into all areas of a business to improve operations and deliver value.

tags.name: Diversification
tags.description: An investment strategy of holding a variety of assets to reduce risk.

tags.name: Dividend Announcement
tags.description: A company's official statement declaring the date and amount of a profit distribution to its shareholders.

tags.name: Domestic Investor
tags.description: An individual or institution that invests in securities within their own country.

tags.name: Global Economy
tags.description: The interconnected economic activities of all countries in the world, including international trade and finance.

tags.name: ESG
tags.description: Stands for Environmental, Social, and Governance; criteria used to measure a company's sustainability and ethical impact.

tags.name: Executive Changes
tags.description: The appointment, resignation, or removal of a company's top-level management.

tags.name: Export
tags.description: The sale of goods and services produced in one country to another country.

tags.name: Financial Metrics
tags.description: Key figures from a company's financial statements used to measure its performance, such as revenue or profit margin.

tags.name: Forex
tags.description: A global marketplace for exchanging national currencies against one another.

tags.name: Foreign Investment
tags.description: Capital invested in a country by an individual or company from another country.

tags.name: Government Policy
tags.description: A plan or action by a government intended to influence decisions and achieve specific outcomes.

tags.name: Halal
tags.description: Pertaining to what is permissible under Islamic law, often applied to finance and food products.

tags.name: Housing Loan
tags.description: A loan obtained from a bank or financial institution for the purpose of buying a property.

tags.name: Import
tags.description: The purchase of goods or services from another country to be brought into one's own country.

tags.name: Inflation
tags.description: The rate at which the general level of prices for goods and services is rising, reducing the purchasing power of currency.

tags.name: Institutional Investor
tags.description: A large organization, such as a pension fund or mutual fund, that invests on behalf of its members.

tags.name: Insider Trading
tags.description: The illegal act of buying or selling securities based on confidential information not available to the public.

tags.name: Interest Rate
tags.description: The percentage of a loan charged by a lender to a borrower for the use of assets.

tags.name: IPO
tags.description: Initial Public Offering; the first time a private company offers its shares to the public.

tags.name: Joint Operation
tags.description: A business arrangement where two or more parties collaborate on a specific project by pooling resources.

tags.name: Joint Venture
tags.description: A business entity created by two or more parties, characterized by shared ownership, risks, and returns.

tags.name: Market Sentiment
tags.description: The overall attitude or tone of investors toward a particular financial market or security.

tags.name: Mergers & Acquisitions
tags.description: The consolidation of companies or assets through various types of financial transactions.

tags.name: Ministry
tags.description: A government department responsible for a specific area of public administration.

tags.name: MoU
tags.description: Memorandum of Understanding; a non-binding agreement that outlines the terms of a future formal agreement.

tags.name: Mortgage
tags.description: A loan specifically used to finance the purchase of real estate.

tags.name: OJK
tags.description: Otoritas Jasa Keuangan; the Indonesian Financial Services Authority that regulates the country's financial sector.

tags.name: Oversubscribed
tags.description: A situation where the demand for newly issued shares is greater than the number of shares available.

tags.name: Overvalued
tags.description: A condition where an asset's price is higher than its determined intrinsic or fundamental value.

tags.name: Ownership
tags.description: The legal right of possession over an asset; in business, it often refers to holding company shares.

tags.name: Partnerships & Agreements
tags.description: A formal arrangement where two or more parties agree to cooperate to advance their mutual interests.

tags.name: Pension Fund
tags.description: A fund that collects and invests capital to provide retirement income for employees.

tags.name: Pilot Project
tags.description: A small-scale, preliminary study conducted to evaluate the feasibility of a full-scale project.

tags.name: Politics & Regulation
tags.description: The influence of government actions, political events, and legal rules on markets and businesses.

tags.name: Portfolio
tags.description: A collection of financial assets, such as stocks, bonds, and cash, held by an investor.

tags.name: Private Placement
tags.description: The sale of securities to a small number of pre-selected investors rather than on the public market.

tags.name: Product Launch
tags.description: The introduction of a new product or service to the market for sale.

tags.name: Production & Operations
tags.description: The business function responsible for creating goods or delivering services.

tags.name: R&D
tags.description: Research and Development; activities undertaken by companies to innovate and introduce new products and services.

tags.name: Rights Issue
tags.description: An offer to existing shareholders to buy additional shares in the company, often at a discount.

tags.name: Risk & Compliance
tags.description: The process of ensuring a company adheres to laws and regulations while managing potential threats.

tags.name: Shareholders General Meeting
tags.description: A mandatory annual meeting of a company's shareholders to discuss company affairs and vote on key issues.

tags.name: Sharia Economy
tags.description: An economic system based on Islamic principles, which prohibits interest (riba) and promotes ethical investments.

tags.name: Stock Buyback
tags.description: When a company repurchases its own shares from the open market to reduce the number of outstanding shares.

tags.name: Stock Split
tags.description: A corporate action where a company increases its number of shares by dividing existing shares, lowering the per-share price.

tags.name: Subsidies & Incentives
tags.description: Financial aid or support provided by a government to a business or economic sector.

tags.name: Subsidiaries
tags.description: A company that is controlled by a parent or holding company.

tags.name: Suspension
tags.description: A temporary stop in the trading of a specific security on a stock exchange.

tags.name: Tariff & VAT
tags.description: A tax on imported goods (Tariff) and a consumption tax on goods and services (Value-Added Tax).

tags.name: Trading Halt
tags.description: A temporary suspension of trading for an the ENTIRE MARKET, imposed by a stock exchange or regulator.

tags.name: Undervalued
tags.description: A condition where an asset's price is lower than its determined intrinsic or fundamental value.

tags.name: Violation
tags.description: An act that breaks a law, rule, or agreement.
